intro: Trimezia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved trimezia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are elongated and lance-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens. Trimezia longifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight.
